channel.title: rmarkdown on Alison Hill
channel.description: Recent content in rmarkdown on Alison Hill

item.title: Introduce yourself online with blogdown & Hugo Ap√©ro
item.description: A workshop for building a personal website from the comfort of RStudio using the blogdown R package, using a Hugo theme I developed.

item.title: Crafting Kind Tools
item.description: Whenever you use software, you are also using a tool that was crafted by someone else. Is it kind? Does it matter? What makes a tool kind?

item.title: Making R Markdown work better for you
item.description: Made with YAML, strings, and glue.

item.title: Introduce yourself online
item.description: A special workshop for rstudio::global() diversity scholars

item.title: Up & running with blogdown in 2021
item.description: New year, new blogdown! A guide to getting up and running with blogdown, the Hugo Wowchemy starter-academic theme, GitHub, and Netlify. Not brief.

item.title: Unbreak your blogdown site
item.description: The latest release of the blogdown package (not yet on CRAN) includes new checking functions to help users make less breakable Hugo sites.

item.title: M-F-E-O: postcards + distill
item.description: The new postcards package and distill are M-F-E-O (made for each other). Here is a brief walk-through to add a postcards personal profile page to your distill website or blog, using only R Markdown.

item.description: Recent updates in the R Markdown family

item.description: A four-hour workshop for R / Pharma 2020 that will take you on a tour of how to get from data to manuscript using R Markdown.

item.title: Teaching in Production
item.description: A 2-hour workshop for RStudio certified trainers on how to make shareable slides and websites with R Markdown.

item.title: How I Taught Tidymodels, Virtually
item.description: Some reflections on my third time teaching tidymodels for machine learning, and doing it virtually.

item.title: How I Teach R Markdown
item.description: A handful of guiding principles for introducing beginners to the R Markdown family of packages.

item.description: A one-hour introduction to R Markdown.

item.description: A workshop for R Markdown users who want to get more out of R Markdown (and friends).

item.description: Using R Markdown in an end-to-end workflow to go from data to manuscript
